page.title: 10SCHOOL CLOSURE cont..
page.content: 20 is generally considered to be the viable number for a rural primary school. When numbers drop below this, closure is threatened on both educational and financial grounds. The campaign by locals to save Collessie Primary School began in 1980 and included making representations to the Schools Council and Education Committee. These efforts failed and many felt that this was a great blow to the community. Coffee evenings and night classes had been held in the school. The latter were held in the village hall but ended within a year because of lack of support. One parent felt that the closure of the school "Had taken the heart out of the community!". Former pupils attended a function to mark the closure of the school. The building itself was sold and is now a private house
